async_info.video_title: Turkey-Syria: 'The heart of my family has died' - BBC News
async_info.video_description:
Turkey‚Äôs government has given Syrian refugees a deadline to move back to the areas they were registered in or risk deportation back to their war-torn home country.
About 3.7 million Syrian refugees now live in Turkey after fleeing the civil war.
The BBC has been told about refugees forced to leave their families behind, including Hisham whose three children have been left without a father.
Video journalist: Patrick Clahane
Please subscribe HERE http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

comment_content.original_script: BBC? Turkey has officially at-least 3.7 million syrian refugees, BUT IN REALITY that number is much, much higher. WARNING! Turkey is not a super-OIL-rich-country-swimming-in-petro-dollars! And all of you western countries are always looking down on Turkey. Looking down on Turkey as a poor and none-democratic country. Then how do you expect Turkey to take care of millions upon millions of refugees like this? I feel bad for the Syrian refugees too, we all do! But if you truly think that they are being mistreated in Turkey, how about YOU OPEN YOUR DOORS SOME MORE TO THEM and get our between 5-8 millions of myriad of refugees into your own country? It's easy to sit atop your high-castle and tell others what to do. Lead by example! Most nations that are officially much more ''advanced'' and/or ''richer'' than turkey have taken in nowhere near as many refugees as Turkey has done! Yet RIGHT-WING extremism is rising in those so called western ''humanitarian'' nations at an alarming rate! Heheh, then you turn it all around and look down on the Turks for not taking proper care of refugees. Without Russia and Iran and others to stop the wars and without Turkey to take the refugees, you would be knee-deep in a sea of migrants in your own countries. If you think it's bad for you now, imagine how bad it would really be if Turkey's total sum of refugees were unleashed on your own nations.

Turkey is not a super-OIL-rich-country-swimming-in-petro-dollars! And all of you western countries are always looking down on Turkey. Looking down on Turkey as a poor and none-democratic country. Then how do you expect Turkey to take care of millions upon millions of refugees like this? I feel bad for the Syrian refugees too, we all do! But if you truly think that they are being mistreated in Turkey, how about YOU OPEN YOUR DOORS SOME MORE TO THEM and get our between 5-8 millions of myriad of refugees into your own country? It's easy to sit atop your high-castle and tell others what to do. Lead by example! Most nations that are officially much more ''advanced'' and/or ''richer'' than turkey have taken in nowhere near as many refugees as Turkey has done! Yet RIGHT-WING extremism is rising in those so called western ''humanitarian'' nations at an alarming rate! Heheh, then you turn it all around and look down on the Turks for not taking proper care of refugees. Without Russia and Iran and others to stop the wars and without Turkey to take the refugees, you would be knee-deep in a sea of migrants in your own countries. If you think it's bad for you now, imagine how bad it would really be if Turkey's total sum of refugees were unleashed on your own nations.
